meanings.definition: Something left over from a previous time or event.
meanings.sent1: The carryovers from the party were leftover snacks and decorations.
meanings.sent2: I always find carryovers of my childhood toys when cleaning out the attic.
meanings.sent3: The carryovers of the failed experiment were quite comical.
meanings.sent4: Her messy room was a carryover of her busy week.
meanings.sent5: The carryovers of the storm were fallen branches and puddles everywhere.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring or continuing something from one time or place to another.
meanings.sent1: The carryovers of knowledge from one generation to the next are invaluable.
meanings.sent2: The carryovers of traditions help maintain cultural heritage.
meanings.sent3: The carryovers of the relay race were quite entertaining to watch.
meanings.sent4: The carryovers of emotions can affect our present decisions.
meanings.sent5: The carryovers of technology have revolutionized the way we communicate.
